text: Approved piping materials, sizing, insulation, and layout as per spec and drawings
Isometric and spool drawings reviewed and coordinated with other trades
Supports, guides, and anchors designed for thermal expansion and contraction
Pipes installed level/plumb with correct slope (especially for air removal and drains)
Isolation valves, strainers, unions, balancing valves, pressure/temp ports installed per plans
Expansion loops or joints in place for long runs; no pipe stress or unsupported sections
Flexible connectors installed at pumps and equipment
Pipe identification labels and flow direction arrows in place
Air separator, expansion tank, and automatic air vents installed correctly and operational
Glycol feeder installed, filled, and relief protection in place (if applicable)
Hydronic pumps installed with correct orientation, isolators, and accessible
Pressure test (typically 1.5x working pressure or per spec) witnessed and passed
Flushing and chemical cleaning completed; water sample submitted for analysis
System filled, de-aired, and flow direction confirmed
Pipe insulation installed: correct thickness, vapor barrier sealed, no exposed gaps
As-built drawings submitted with piping routes, valves, and test data
O&M manuals provided for pumps, feeders, valves, tanks, and flushing log
AHJ and mechanical engineer signoff completed

id: • ASHRAE 90.1, 55, NBC Part 6, NECB, CSA B51, B52, ANSI/ASHRAE 111 (Testing)
